title.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Jan. 10, 1894. Recent Publications of the Polish Publishing Company

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

div.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Jan. 10, 1894. RECENT PUBLICATIONS OF THE POLISH PUBLISHING COMPANY

body.p: Realizing the great difficulty and cost of importing school books from Europe, and realizing also the need for books that deal with American and Polish affairs, that is, books that offer instruction in reading and writing, books that cover important facts of Polish and American history, etc., the Polish Publishing Company has published a wide variety of the most essential books for Polish parochial schools in America.
The list is as follows [All published in Polish]:
Primer, printed on good quality paper and illustrated with beautiful pictures, 79 pages. Cost per copy: 20 cents.
First Reader, a 96 page book, illustrated and printed on good paper. Cost per copy: 25 cents.
Second Reader, 176 pages, with illustrations. Cost per copy: 30 cents.
Third Reader, richly illustrated, 308 pages. Cost per copy: 40 cents.
Fourth Reader, 400 pages, with illustrations. Cost per copy: 50 cents.
Arithmetic, Part I, contains fractions, examples and tables, 106 pages. Cost per copy: 30 cents.
Arithmetic, Part II, contains fractions, division, etc., 106 pages. Cost per copy: 30 cents.

Bible History, by Benzinger, 349 pages with illustrations, contains a rescription of His Eminence Pope Leo XIII, and the approbation and recommendation of the Most Reverend Archbishops of Germany, Switzerland and America. Cost per copy: 50 cents.
Bible History, by Herder, a condensed form, with 46 illustrations and 87 pages.

row.cell: Advanced Catechism of the Roman Catholic Church for Polish parochial schools. Cost per copy:
Polish History Sketches, by B. Klarkowski[local author]
Elementary Catechism of the Roman Catholic Church for Polish parochial schools
Dziecie Starego Miasta (Child of the Old City), by J. L. Kraszewski
Mieszczanska Duma (A Girl's Dream), a short story
Krzyz Mogilny (The Cross on the Mound), 1863-1864
Szary Proch (Gray Powder), by M. Rodziewicz
Klopoty Chinczyka (The Troubles of a Chinaman), by Jules Verne
Szkaplerz Matki (Mother's Scapular), by I. Machnikowski
Krol Nocy (King of Night), by A. de Lamothe, two volumes
Kosynierzy (Soldiers with Scythes), by A. de Lamothe, a story of the Polish Insurrection of 1863 based on true facts, with illustrations, two volumes
Polish Geography Manual, fifty illustrations and eight maps
Na Lono Matki (On Mother's Lap), a novel,
Cudowne Groszki (Magic Pennies), and Syn Dziadowski (Beggar's Son), by S. Zahajkiewicz
Ksiaze Czarnoksieznikow (The Prince of Magicians), by S. Zahajkiewicz
Dzieci Izraela (Children of Israel), a biblical drama, by S. Zahajkiewicz
Bog Nie Opusci (God Will Not Forsake), a story by L. Anczyc
Czeczotka (Linnet), a story of the days of old, by Peter J. Bykowski
Kwiat Paproci (The Fern) a three act play, by S. Zahajkiewicz
Z. Tulaczow (The Refugees), by J. I. Kraszewski
Syn Kmieci (Peasant Son), a historical narrative of the times of John Sobieski, by Theresa Jadwiga
Catholic Calendar, for Polish Catholics in America, for 1894
Regulamin Mustry (Drill Regulations), for all Military Societies, 117 pages
Powinszowanie I Deklamacye (Congratulation and Declamation), by S. Zahajkiewicz

body.p: Moje Lyczenie Woda (My Healing With Water), by Reverend Sebastian Kneipp

row.cell: Tak Zyc Potrzeba (How to Live), by Reverend Sebastian Kneipp.
Protekcya a Wolny Handel (Protection and Free Trade), by H. George
Krolowie Polscy (Polish Kings), biographical sketches, illustrated
Tuzin Komedyi (A Dozen Comedies), for young people

body.p: If books are purchased in large numbers a substantial discount is given.
